options.$comment: Options are arguments that start with at least one hyphen

unknown.$comment: Describes how options are treated that have not been configured but are present in argv

exit.$comment: Can parsing unknown options cause the process to exit?

generic.$comment: Will unknown options be present in the parsed output?

handler.$comment: Is it possible to configure a method that will be invoked for unknown options?

throws.$comment: Can parsing unknown options cause the process to throw an Error?

types.$comment: About the possible types for option values

flag.$comment: Can an option be passed without value to set it to true?

boolean.$comment: Can an option be passed a boolean value to set it to true or false?

negated.$comment: Can flags be passed with a prefix to set the value to false?

default-string.$comment: Can a default string be configured when the option is passed as a flag?

string.$comment: Can an option be passed any value that will be treated as a string?

number.$comment: What are the options for converting values to JS number type?

integer.$comment: What are the options for converting values to integer values?

count.$comment: Is there an option to count the number of times an option(/flag) has been passed?

custom.$comment: Is it possible to configure custom option types?

lists.$comment: Types for options that can result in multiple values (see options.syntax.* for details on how to pass them)

array.$comment: Is it possible to configure options to always be a list of values?

typed-items.$comment: Can the type of the items be configured?

aliases.$comment: Aliases are the short form of options

alias.$comment: Can aliases be configured for options?

abbreviations.$comment: Are all possible distinct shortcuts for configured options automatically detected?

in-output.$comment: Are the aliases present as keys in the object returned?

syntax.$comment: Allowed syntax for passing values for options

repeated.$comment: Is it possible to pass an option multiple times to collect values?

multiple.$comment: Is it possible to pass multiple values after a single option?
